alert.note: Alert for Rabun (Georgia) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Greenville-Spartanburg (Western North Carolina and Northwest South Carolina)
info.headline: Flood Advisory issued May 27 at 2:28PM EDT until May 27 at 4:00PM EDT by NWS Greenville-Spartanburg
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 3 PM EDT THIS AFTERNOON... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall continues. * WHERE...Portions of Macon County in western North Carolina and Rabun County in northeast Georgia. * WHEN...Until 300 PM EDT. * IMPACTS...High water conditions resulting in nuisance to minor flooding will continue to recede through the afternoon. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 223 PM EDT, Gage reports were indicating slowly falling river levels along the Little Tennessee and Nantahala Rivers in Macon county. This was also the case for levels along Lake Burton in Rabun County. Based on these trends, the advisory will expire on schedule. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
